SI12: I suggest framing plant-based eating as “shifting” and “adding” rather than “overhauling” and “taking away.” For example, I tell my patients they don’t need to deem themselves vegan or vegetarian, but simply adding more plant foods intake their eating in fun, enjoyable ways and in any form (cooked, pickled, raw, blended, etc.) will help improve their health. I refrain from pigeonholing them into thinking they must become vegan tomorrow, clean out their pantries/fridges, and that it will be difficult and enjoyable but they should “do it for their health.” People change when they feel capable, not when they feel cornered.
